<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q61')" data-correct-answer="E">
<strong style="display: block;">The risk-free rate is 4%, market premium is 6%. A stock with β = 1.1 has an expected return of 12%. What is its alpha?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q61" value="A"> A. -0.6%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q61" value="B"> B. 0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q61" value="C"> C. +0.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q61" value="D"> D. +0.6%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q61" value="E"> E. +1.4%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q61" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: CAPM = 4 + 1.1×6 = 10.6%. Alpha = 12 − 10.6 = +1.4%. 
</div>

:::
